str2: Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and krino; to conclude for oneself, i.e. to respond; by Hebraism to begin to speak.
And not, neither, nor. From ou and te; not too, i.e. Neither or nor; by analogy, not even.
And not, neither, nor. From ou and te; not too, i.e. Neither or nor; by analogy, not even.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A begetter, father; plur: parents. From the base of ginomai; a parent.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Perhaps from a and the base of meros; properly, to miss the mark, i.e. to err, especially to sin.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To make clear (visible, manifest), make known. From phaneros; to render apparent.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
